Posts.Content: kemps wrote: I am a 31 year-old who recently found a large lump in my right breast.   I went to the doctor and had an ultrasound; the doctor told me it was a fibroadenoma and I could either have it removed or I could continue to have it montiored every 6 months with follow-up ultrasounds.  The doctor said if it grows I would have to have it removed; it is approxiately 1x3 cm curretly.   At the time, I decided to continue to monitor but I am starting to second-guess my decision.   Can a doctor really tell if tumor is benign by only looking at an ultrasound?   If so, is there a certain size that I should have it removed at?  Does having this tumor increase my chances of getting breast cancer?
